title: Someone tells me It is Simoncini Garamond
content:
Dear,

I’d like to identify this elegant typeface.  
Someone tells me it is Simoncini Garamond, but numbers (look at my image) are non compatible with the Simoncini’s ones.

Help me!

Link to my image, if you can not see the attached one:  
 [Link](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503010858/http:/img201.imageshack.us/img201/2016/booknw0.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [book.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503010858/http:/typophile.com/files/book_0.jpg) | 619.2 KB |

 [‹ African Hand Lettering style](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503010858/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43774 "Go to previous forum topic") [archetypal neon sign font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503010858/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43791 "Go to next forum topic")
author: technopaegnion

comments.content:
Those are old style figures, which are available in the E+F package of Simocini Garamond.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/garamond-simoncini/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503010858/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/garamond-simoncini/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/garamond-simoncini/")
